subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Legacy: What Survives the Founder
description: A 60-second lesson on Legacy: What Survives the Founder.

hook.text: Walt Disney died in 1966. His company is worth $170 billion today. The founder left, but the vision didn't.

buildup.text: Legacy isn't a founder's name on a building. It's the systems, values, and mission that outlast any individual.

discovery.text: Jim Collins found that great companies build 'clock mechanisms'â€”self-sustaining systems that outlive the creator.

twist.text: Some founders can't let go. The company becomes about them, not the mission. That's a ceiling, not a legacy.

climax.text: Yvon Chouinard gave Patagonia to a trust fighting climate change. The ultimate exit: giving it all away.

punchline.text: A great company outlives its founder. That's the real exit.

quiz.question: What did Yvon Chouinard do with Patagonia?
options: Sold it to a private equity firm for $3 billion
Took it public on the New York Stock Exchange
Gave it to a trust dedicated to fighting climate change
